column1: ## All default BunsenLabs user config files are located in /usr/share/bunsen/skel/.
## The script bl-user-setup copies them to the user $HOME directory on first login.
## See more info with command { bl-user-setup --help; }
# These two utilities are available if you uncomment the line.
# Pipe menu to install and use Dropbox:
# Utility to set language if login greeter does not offer that option:

column2: x-terminal-emulator -T 'inxi system info  (Q to close)' -e bash -c "inxi -F -d -J -l -o -p -r -u -x -z -c 2 | less -R"
"x-terminal-emulator -T 'Select Default Browser' -e sh -c 'sudo update-alternatives --config x-www-browser; sleep 5'"
